description: The cause of the denial of service issue outlined in CVE-2023-38171 stems from a flaw in the Microsoft QUIC component, which is integrated within the network stack of affected systems. This vulnerability allows an attacker to exploit the affected component remotely without requiring user interaction, making it accessible over the Internet. Specifically, the vulnerability impacts PowerShell 7.3 and several versions of Windows 11 (build numbers 10.0.22000.2538, 10.0.22621.2428) and Windows Server 2022, as noted in KB articles KB-5031358 and KB-5031354. The nature of the exploitation results in a significant disruption of service availability, which can either be temporary or persistent based on the attacker’s actions. Microsoft has categorized the maximum severity of this issue as important, indicating it poses a considerable risk to affected systems.
